alert.note: Alert for Blanco; Burnet; Gillespie; Llano (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 5:48PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Blanco, Gillespie, Llano and Burnet Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 548 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Lampasas to Tow to near Stolz to Oxford to 6 miles northeast of Tivydale. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fredericksburg, Burnet, Marble Falls, Kingsland, Llano, Round Mountain, Buchanan Dam, Gainesville, Granite Shoals, Horseshoe Bay, Meadowlakes, Buchanan Lake Village, Stonewall, Highland Haven, Inks Lake State Park, Blowout, Watson, Bluffton, Rocky Hill, and Lake Victor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Texas.
